greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle where the g.f. of column k is 1/(1-x)^(k^2) for k>=1, as read by rows n>=1.
comment: This is also the array A(n,k) read upwards antidiagonals, where the entry in row n and column k counts the vertex-labeled digraphs with n arcs and k vertices, allowing multi-edges and multi-loops (labeled analog to A138107). The binomial formula counts the weak compositions of distributing n arcs over the k^2 positions in the adjacency matrix. - _R. J. Mathar_, Aug 03 2017
link: Paul D. Hanna, Rows n = 0..45, flattened.
R. J. Mathar, Statistics on Small Graphs, arXiv:1709.09000 (2017) Table 80.
xref: Cf. A214400 (central terms), A178325 (row sums), A054688, A000290 (1st subdiagonal), A037270 (2nd subdiagonal).
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Jul 15 2012
